page.title: 13LANDSCAPE..WOODLAND
page.content: 18% of the area is wooded. A small proportion of this is for amenity purposes and for windbreaks. The rest is part of a 419 hectare Forestry Commission plantation in the Ladybank area. Most of the trees were planted between 1923 and 1930. 80_90% of the trees are Scots Pine, the rest are Sitka Spruce, Norway Spruce and Larch. Some felling is now being carried out and to avoid the impact on the environment being too great, a reaforestation programme is underway. Felling of the original trees has been staggered and will continue until the year 2010. Most of the timber is sent to local sawmills with the smaller pieces being used for chipboard or pulping. The forestry commission are happy to allow acess to the woodland by the walking public ie. nature trails.
